org.tinyradius.server

Class DeduplicatorHandler<T extends RadiusPacket>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tinyradius.server.DeduplicatorHandler<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RequestHandler<T>

    public class DeduplicatorHandler<T extends RadiusPacket>
extends java.lang.Object
implements RequestHandler<T>
    Handler that wraps around another handler and deduplicates requests, returning null if duplicate. This considers packets duplicate if packetIdentifier and remote address matches.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DeduplicatorHandler(RequestHandler<T> requestHandler, io.netty.util.Timer timer, long ttlMs)

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeduplicatorHandler

        public DeduplicatorHandler(RequestHandler<T> requestHandler,
                           io.netty.util.Timer timer,
                           long ttlMs)
        Parameters:
        requestHandler - underlying handler to process packet if not duplicate
        timer - used to set timeouts that clean up packets after predefined TTL
        ttlMs - time in ms to keep packets in cache and ignore duplicates

    • Method Detail

      • handlePacket

        public io.netty.util.concurrent.Promise<RadiusPacket> handlePacket(io.netty.channel.Channel channel,
                                                                   T request,
                                                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress remoteAddress,
                                                                   java.lang.String sharedSecret)
        Description copied from interface: RequestHandler
        Handles the received Radius packet and constructs a clientResponse.
        Specified by:
        handlePacket in interface RequestHandler<T extends RadiusPacket>
        Parameters:
        channel - socket which received packet
        request - the packet
        remoteAddress - remote address the packet was sent by
        sharedSecret - shared secret associated with remoteAddress
        Returns:
        null if packet is considered duplicate, otherwise delegates to underlying handler.

      • isPacketDuplicate

        public boolean isPacketDuplicate(RadiusPacket packet,
                                 java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Checks whether the passed packet is a duplicate. A packet is duplicate if another packet with the same identifier has been sent from the same host.

        If duplicate is received, TTL of the packet will NOT rebased to the most recent hit.

        Parameters:
        packet - packet in question
        address - client address
        Returns:
        true if it is duplicate
